meanings.definition: A specimen selected to serve as the type specimen when the original type is lost or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The scientist chose a neotype to represent the species after the original specimen was lost.
meanings.sent2: In biology, a neotype is selected when the original sample is no longer available.
meanings.sent3: The neotype of the rare flower was actually a plastic replica, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a neotype of happiness, bright and unmistakable.
meanings.sent5: The neotype of the ancient artifact was carefully displayed in the museum for all to see.

meanings.definition: A specimen selected to serve as the type specimen when the original type is found to be inadequate.
meanings.sent1: The neotype was chosen to replace the original specimen that was deemed unsuitable.
meanings.sent2: When the first sample was not good enough, they selected a neotype to represent the species.
meanings.sent3: The neotype of the fruit turned out to be a fake made of wax, much to the botanist's dismay.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a neotype of joy, infectious and heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The neotype of the painting was a stunning replica that fooled even the experts.
